intro: Ottoschulzia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban star-of-Bahamas, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange composite flowers that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Ottoschulzia cubensis has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds in a disk-like structure surrounded by ray florets. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and resilience to coastal conditions.
